entry.label: Creation
entry.description: Date identifies when the resource was brought into existence

entry.label: Publication
entry.description: Date identifies when the resource was issued

entry.label: Revision
entry.description: Date identifies when the resource was examined or re-examined and improved or amended

entry.label: Download
entry.description: Online instructions for transferring data from one storage device or system to another

entry.label: Information
entry.description: Online information about the resource

entry.label: Offline access
entry.description: Online instructions for requesting the resource from the provider

entry.label: Order
entry.description: Online order process for obtening the resource

entry.label: Search
entry.description: Online search interface for seeking out information about the resource

entry.label: Digital document
entry.description: Digital representation of a primarily textual item (can contain illustrations also)

entry.label: Digital image
entry.description: Likeness of natural or man-made features, objects, and activities acquired through the sensing of visual or any other segment of the electromagnetic spectrum by sensors, such as thermal infrared, and high resolution radar and stored in digital format

entry.label: Hardcopy document
entry.description: Representation of a primarily textual item (can contain illustrations also) on paper, photograhic material, or other media

entry.label: Hardcopy image
entry.description: Likeness of natural or man-made features, objects, and activities acquired through the sensing of visual or any other segment of the electromagnetic spectrum by sensors, such as thermal infrared, and high resolution radar and reproduced on paper, photographic material, or other media for use directly by the human user

entry.label: Digital map
entry.description: Map represented in raster or vector form

entry.label: Hardcopy map
entry.description: Map printed on paper, photographic material, or other media for use directly by the human user

entry.label: Digital model
entry.description: Multi-dimensional digital representation of a feature, process, etc.

entry.label: Hardcopy model
entry.description: 3-dimensional, physical model

entry.label: Digital profile
entry.description: Vertical cross-section in digital form

entry.label: Hardcopy profile
entry.description: Vertical cross-section printed on paper, etc.

entry.label: Digital table
entry.description: Digital representation of facts or figures systematically displayed, especially in columns

entry.label: Hardcopy table
entry.description: Representation of facts or figures systematically displayed, especially in columns, printed onpapers, photographic material, or other media

entry.label: Digital video
entry.description: Digital video recording

entry.label: Hardcopy video
entry.description: Video recording on film

entry.label: Resource provider
entry.description: Party that supplies the resource

entry.label: Custodian
entry.description: Party that accepts accountability and responsability for the data and ensures appropriate care and maintenance of the resource

entry.label: Owner
entry.description: Party that owns the resource

entry.label: User
entry.description: Party who uses the resource

entry.label: Distributor
entry.description: Party who distributes the resource

entry.label: Originator
entry.description: Party who created the resource

entry.label: Point of contact
entry.description: Party who can be contacted for acquiring knowledge about or acquisition of the resource

entry.label: Principal investigator
entry.description: Key party responsible for gathering information and conducting research

entry.label: Processor
entry.description: Party wha has processed the data in a manner such that the resource has been modified

entry.label: Publisher
entry.description: Party who published the resource

entry.label: Author
entry.description: Party who authored the resource

entry.label: Direct internal
entry.description: Method of evaluating the quality of a dataset based on inspection of items within the dataset, where all data required is internal to the dataset being evaluated

entry.label: Direct external
entry.description: Method of evaluating the quality of a dataset based on inspection of items within the dataset, where reference data external to the dataset being evaluated is required

entry.label: Indirect
entry.description: Method of evaluating the quality of a dataset based on external knowledge

entry.label: Cross reference
entry.description: Reference from one dataset to another

entry.label: Larger work citation
entry.description: Reference to a master dataset of which this one is a part

entry.label: Part of seamless database
entry.description: Part of the same structured set of data held in a computer

entry.label: Source
entry.description: Mapping and charting information from which the dataset content originates

entry.label: Stereo mate
entry.description: Part of a set of imagery that when used together, provides three-dimensional images

entry.label: Campaign
entry.description: Series of organized planned actions

entry.label: Collection
entry.description: Accumulation of datasets assembled for a specific purpose

entry.label: Exercise
entry.description: Specific performance of a function or group of functions

entry.label: Experiment
entry.description: Process designed to find if something is effective or valid

entry.label: Investigation
entry.description: Search or systematic inquiry

entry.label: Mission
entry.description: Specific operation of a data collection system

entry.label: Sensor
entry.description: Device or piece of equipment which detects or records

entry.label: Operation
entry.description: Action that is part of a series of actions

entry.label: Platform
entry.description: Vehicle or other support base that holds a sensor

entry.label: Process
entry.description: Method of doing something involving a number of steps

entry.label: Program
entry.description: Specific planned activity

entry.label: Project
entry.description: Organized undertaking, research, or development

entry.label: Study
entry.description: Examination or investigation

entry.label: Task
entry.description: Piece of work

entry.label: Trial
entry.description: Process of testing to discover or demonstrate something

entry.label: Point
entry.description: Each cell represents a point

entry.label: Area
entry.description: Each cell represents an area

entry.label: UCS2
entry.description: 16-bit fixed size Universal Character Set, based on ISO/IEC 10646

entry.label: UCS4
entry.description: 32-bit fixed size Universal Character Set, based on ISO/IEC 10646

entry.label: UTF7
entry.description: 7-bit variable size UCS Transfer Format, based on ISO/IEC 10646

entry.label: UTF8
entry.description: 8-bit variable size UCS Transfer Format, based on ISO/IEC 10646

entry.label: UTF16
entry.description: 16-bit variable size UCS Transfer Format, based on ISO/IEC 10646

entry.label: 8859 Part 1
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-1, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 1 : Latin alphabet No.1

entry.label: 8859 Part 2
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-2, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 2 : Latin alphabet No.2

entry.label: 8859 Part 3
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-3, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 3 : Latin alphabet No.3

entry.label: 8859 Part 4
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-4, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 4 : Latin alphabet No.4

entry.label: 8859 Part 5
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-5, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 5 : Latin/Cyrillic alphabet

entry.label: 8859 Part 6
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-6, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 6 : Latin/Arabic alphabet

entry.label: 8859 Part 7
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-7, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 7 : Latin/Greek alphabet

entry.label: 8859 Part 8
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-8, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 8 : Latin/Hebrew alphabet

entry.label: 8859 Part 9
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-9, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 9 : Latin alphabet No.5

entry.label: 8859 Part 10
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-10, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 10 : Latin alphabet No.6

entry.label: 8859 Part 11
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-11, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 11 : Latin/Thai alphabet

entry.label: 8859 Part 13
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-13, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 13 : Latin alphabet No.7

entry.label: 8859 Part 14
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-14, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 14 : Latin alphabet No.8 (Celtic)

entry.label: 8859 Part 15
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-15, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 15 : Latin alphabet No.9

entry.label: 8859 Part 16
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-16, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 16 : Latin alphabet No.10

entry.label: JIS
entry.description: Japanese code set used for electronic transmission

entry.label: Shift JIS
entry.description: Japanese code set used on MS-DOS machines

entry.label: EUC JP
entry.description: Japanese code set used on UNIX based machines

entry.label: US ASCII
entry.description: United States ASCII code set (ISO 646 US)

entry.label: EBCDIC
entry.description: IBM mainframe code set

entry.label: EUC KR
entry.description: Korean code set

entry.label: Big 5
entry.description: Traditional Chinese code set used in Taiwan, Hong Kong of China and other areas

entry.label: GB2312
entry.description: Simplified Chinese code set

entry.label: Unclassified
entry.description: Available for general disclosure

entry.label: Restricted
entry.description: Not for general disclosure

entry.label: Confidential
entry.description: Available for someone who can be entrusted with information

entry.label: Secret
entry.description: Kept or meant to be kept private, unknown, or hidden from all but a select group of people

entry.label: Top secret
entry.description: Of the highest secrecy

entry.label: Image
entry.description: Meaningful numerical representation of a physical parameter that is not the actual value of the physical parameter

entry.label: Thematic classification
entry.description: Code value with no quantitative meaning, used to represent a physical quantity

entry.label: Physical measurement
entry.description: Value in physical units of the quantity being measured

entry.label: Class
entry.description: Descriptor of a set of objects that share the same attributes, operations, methods, relationships, and behavior

entry.label: Codelist
entry.description: Descriptor of a set of objects that share the same attributes, operations, methods, relationships, and behavior

entry.label: Enumeration
entry.description: Data type whose instances form a list of named literal values, not extendable

entry.label: Codelist element
entry.description: Permissible value for a codelist or enumeration

entry.label: Abstract class
entry.description: Class that cannot be directly instantiated

entry.label: Aggregate class
entry.description: Class that is composed of classes it is connected to by an aggregate relationship

entry.label: Specified class
entry.description: Subclass that may be substituted for its superclass

entry.label: Datatype class
entry.description: Class with few or no operations whose primary purpose is to hold the abstract state of another class for transmittal, storage, encoding or persistent storage

entry.label: Interface class
entry.description: Named set of operations that characterize the behavior of an element

entry.label: Union class
entry.description: Class describing a selection of one of the specified types

entry.label: Meta class
entry.description: Class whose instances are classes

entry.label: Type class
entry.description: Class used for specification of a domain of instances (objects), together with the operations applicable to the objects. A type may have attributes and associations

entry.label: Character string
entry.description: Free text field

entry.label: Integer
entry.description: Numerical field

entry.label: Association
entry.description: Semantic relationship between two classes that involves connections among their instances

entry.label: Row
entry.description: Ordinate (y) axis

entry.label: Column
entry.description: Abscissa (x) axis

entry.label: Vertical
entry.description: Vertical (z) axis

entry.label: Track
entry.description: Along the direction of motion of the scan point

entry.label: Cross track
entry.description: Perpendicular to the direction of motion of the scan point

entry.label: Line
entry.description: Scan line of a sensor

entry.label: Sample
entry.description: Element along a scan line

entry.label: Time
entry.description: Duration

entry.label: Complex
entry.description: Set of geometric primitives such that their boundaries can be represented as a union of other primitives

entry.label: Composite
entry.description: Connected set of curves, solids or surfaces

entry.label: Curve
entry.description: Bounded, 1-dimensional geometric primitive, representing the continuous image of a line

entry.label: Point
entry.description: Zero-dimensional geometric primitive, representing a position but not having an extent

entry.label: Solid
entry.description: Bounded, connected 3-dimensional geometric primitive, representing the continuous image of a region of space

entry.label: Surface
entry.description: Bounded, connected 2-dimensional geometric primitive, representing the continuous image of a region of a plane

entry.label: Blurred image
entry.description: Portion of the image is blurred

entry.label: Cloud
entry.description: Portion of the image is partially obscured by cloud cover

entry.label: Degrading obliquity
entry.description: Acute angle between the plane of the ecliptic (the plane of the Earth s orbit) and the plane of the celestial equator

entry.label: Fog
entry.description: Portion of the image is partially obscured by fog

entry.label: Heavy smoke or dust
entry.description: Portion of the image is partially obscured by heavy smoke or dust

entry.label: Night
entry.description: Image was taken at night

entry.label: Rain
entry.description: Image was taken during rainfall

entry.label: Semi darkness
entry.description: Image was taken during semi-dark conditions -- twilight conditions

entry.label: Shadow
entry.description: Portion of the image is obscured by shadow

entry.label: Snow
entry.description: Portion of the image is obscured by snow

entry.label: Terrain masking
entry.description: The absence of collection data of a given point or area caused by the relative location of topographic features which obstruct the collection path between the collector(s) and the subject(s) of interest

entry.label: Discipline
entry.description: Keyword identifies a branch of instruction or specialized learning

entry.label: Place
entry.description: Keyword identifies a location

entry.label: Stratum
entry.description: Keyword identifies the layer(s) of any deposited substance

entry.label: Temporal
entry.description: Keyword identifies a time period related to the dataset

entry.label: Theme
entry.description: Keyword identifies a particular subject or topic

entry.label: Continual
entry.description: Data is repeatedly and frequently updated

entry.label: Daily
entry.description: Data is updated each day

entry.label: Weekly
entry.description: Data is updated on a weekly basis

entry.label: Fortnightly
entry.description: Data is updated every two weeks

entry.label: Monthly
entry.description: Data is updated each month

entry.label: Quarterly
entry.description: Data is updated every three months

entry.label: Biannually
entry.description: Data is updated twice each year

entry.label: Annually
entry.description: Data is updated every year

entry.label: As needed
entry.description: Data is updated as deemed necessary

entry.label: Irregular
entry.description: Data is updated in intervals that are uneven in duration

entry.label: Not planned
entry.description: There are no plans to update the data

entry.label: Unknown
entry.description: Frequency of maintenance for the data is not known

entry.label: CPIO
entry.description: CoPy In / Out (UNIX file format and command)

entry.label: TAR
entry.description: Tape ARchive

entry.label: High sierra
entry.description: High sierra file system

entry.label: ISO9660
entry.description: Information processing volume and file structure of CD-ROM

entry.label: ISO9660 Rock Ridge
entry.description: Rock ridge interchange protocol (UNIX)

entry.label: ISO9660 Apple HFS
entry.description: Hierarchical file system (Macintosh)

entry.label: CDROM
entry.description: Read-only optical disk

entry.label: DVD
entry.description: Digital versatile disk

entry.label: DVDROM
entry.description: Digital versatile disk, read only

entry.label: 3 Half Inch Floppy
entry.description: 3,5 inch magnetic disk

entry.label: 5 Quarter Inch Floppy
entry.description: 5,25 inch magnetic disk

entry.label: 7 Track tape
entry.description: 7 track magnetic tape

entry.label: 9 track tape
entry.description: 9 track magnetic tape

entry.label: 3480 Cartridge
entry.description: 3480 cartridge tape drive

entry.label: 3490 Cartridge
entry.description: 3490 cartridge tape drive

entry.label: 3580 Cartridge
entry.description: 3580 cartridge tape drive

entry.label: 4 mm Cartridge tape
entry.description: 4 millimetre magnetic tape

entry.label: 8 mm Cartridge tape
entry.description: 8 millimetre magnetic tape

entry.label: 1 Quarter inch cartridge tape
entry.description: 0,25 inch magnetic tape

entry.label: Digital linear tape
entry.description: Half inch cartridge streaming tape drive

entry.label: Online
entry.description: Direct computer linkage

entry.label: Satellite
entry.description: Linkage through a satellite communication system

entry.label: Telephone link
entry.description: Communication through a telephone network

entry.label: Hardcopy
entry.description: Pamphlet or leaflet giving descriptive information

entry.label: Mandatory
entry.description: Element is always required

entry.label: Optional
entry.description: Element is not required

entry.label: Conditional
entry.description: Element is required when a specific condition is met

entry.label: Center
entry.description: Point halfway between the lower left and the upper right of the pixel

entry.label: Lower left
entry.description: The corner in the pixel closest to the origin of the SRS; if two are at the same distance from the origin, the one with the smallest x-value

entry.label: Lower right
entry.description: Next corner counterclockwise from the lower left

entry.label: Upper right
entry.description: Next corner counterclockwise from the lower right

entry.label: Upper left
entry.description: Next corner counterclockwise from the upper right

entry.label: Completed
entry.description: Production of the data has been completed

entry.label: Historical archive
entry.description: Data has been stored in an offline storage facility

entry.label: Obsolete
entry.description: Data is no longer relevant

entry.label: On going
entry.description: Data is continually being updated

entry.label: Planned
entry.description: Fixed date has been established upon or by which the data will be created or updated

entry.label: Required
entry.description: Data needs to be generated or updated

entry.label: Under development
entry.description: Data is currently in the process of being created

entry.label: Copyright
entry.description: Exclusive right to the publication, production, or sale of the rights to a literary, dramatic, musical, or artistic work, or to the use of a commercial print or label, granted by law for a specified period of time to an author, composer, artist, distributor

entry.label: Patent
entry.description: Government has granted exclusive right to make, sell, use or license an invention or discovery

entry.label: Pending patent
entry.description: Produced or sold information awaiting a patent

entry.label: Trademark
entry.description: A name, symbol, or other device identifying a product, officially registered and legally restricted to the use of the owner or manufacturer

entry.label: License
entry.description: Formal permission to do something

entry.label: Intellectual property rights
entry.description: Rights to financial benefit from and control of distribution of non-tangible property that is a result of creativity

entry.label: Restricted
entry.description: Withheld from general circulation or disclosure

entry.label: Other restrictions
entry.description: Limitation not listed

entry.label: Attribute
entry.description: Information applies to the attribute class

entry.label: Attribute type
entry.description: Information applies to the characteristic of a feature

entry.label: Collection hardware
entry.description: Information applies to the collection hardware class

entry.label: Collection session
entry.description: Information applies to the collection session

entry.label: Dataset
entry.description: Information applies to the dataset

entry.label: Series
entry.description: Information applies to the series

entry.label: Non geographic dataset
entry.description: Information applies to non-geographic data

entry.label: Dimension group
entry.description: Information applies to a dimension group

entry.label: Feature
entry.description: Information applies to a feature

entry.label: Feature type
entry.description: Information applies to a feature type

entry.label: Property type
entry.description: Information applies to a property type

entry.label: Field session
entry.description: Information applies to a field session

entry.label: Software
entry.description: Information applies to a computer program or routine

entry.label: Service
entry.description: Information applies to a capability which a service provider entity makes available to a service user entity through a set of interfaces that define a behaviour, such as a use case

entry.label: Model
entry.description: Information applies to a copy or imitation of an existing or hypothetical object

entry.label: Tile
entry.description: Information applies to a tile, a spatial subset of geographic data

entry.label: Vector
entry.description: Vector data is used to represent geographic data

entry.label: Grid
entry.description: Grid data is used to represent geographic data

entry.label: Text, table
entry.description: Textual or tabular data is used to represent geographic data

entry.label: TIN
entry.description: Triangulated irregular network

entry.label: Stereo model
entry.description: Three-dimensional view formed by the intersecting homologous rays of an overlapping pair of images

entry.label: Video
entry.description: Scene from a video recording

entry.label: Farming
entry.description: Rearing of animals and/or cultivation of plants. Examples: agriculture, irrigation, aquaculture, plantations, herding, pests and diseases affecting crops and livestock

entry.label: Biota
entry.description: Flora and/or fauna in natural environment. Examples: wildlife, vegetation, biological sciences, ecology, wilderness, sealife, wetlands, habitat

entry.label: Boundaries
entry.description: Legal land descriptions. Examples: political and administrative boundaries

entry.label: Climatology, meteorology, atmosphere
entry.description: Processes and phenomena of the atmosphere. Examples: cloud cover, weather, climate, atmospheric conditions, climate change, precipitation

entry.label: Economy
entry.description: Economic activities, conditions and employment. Examples: production, labour, revenue, commerce, industry, tourism and ecotourism, forestry, fisheries, commercial or subsistence hunting, exploration and exploitation of resources such as minerals, oil and gas

entry.label: Elevation
entry.description: Height above or below sea level. Examples: altitude, bathymetry, digital elevation models, slope, derived products

entry.label: Environment
entry.description: Environmental resources, protection and conservation. Examples: environmental pollution, waste storage and treatment, environmental impact assessment, monitoring environmental risk, nature reserves, landscape

entry.label: Geoscientific information
entry.description: Information pertaining to earth sciences. Examples: geophysical features and processes, geology, minerals, sciences dealing with the composition, structure and origin of the earth s rocks, risks of earthquakes, volcanic activity, landslides, gravity information, soils, permafrost, hydrogeology, erosion

entry.label: Health
entry.description: Health, health services, human ecology, and safety. Examples: disease and illness, factors affecting health, hygiene, substance abuse, mental and physical health, health services

entry.label: Imagery base maps earth cover
entry.description: Base maps. Examples: land cover, topographic maps, imagery, unclassified images, annotations

entry.label: Intelligence military
entry.description: Military bases, structures, activities. Examples: barracks, training grounds, military transportation, information collection

entry.label: Inland waters
entry.description: Inland water features, drainage systems and their characteristics. Examples: rivers and glaciers, salt lakes, water utilization plans, dams, currents, floods, water quality, hydrographic charts

entry.label: Location
entry.description: Positional information and services. Examples: addresses, geodetic networks, control points, postal zones and services, place names

entry.label: Oceans
entry.description: Features and characteristics of salt water bodies (excluding inland waters). Examples: tides, tidal waves, coastal information, reefs

entry.label: Planning cadastre
entry.description: Information used for appropriate actions for future use of the land. Examples: land use maps, zoning maps, cadastral surveys, land ownership

entry.label: Society
entry.description: Characteristics of society and cultures. Examples: settlements, anthropology, archaeology, education, traditional beliefs, manners and customs, demographic data, recreational areas and activities, social impact assessments, crime and justice, census information

entry.label: Structure
entry.description: Man-made construction. Examples: buildings, museums, churches, factories, housing, monuments, shops, towers

entry.label: Transportation
entry.description: Means and aids for conveying persons and/or goods. Examples: roads, airports/airstrips, shipping routes, tunnels, nautical charts, vehicle or vessel location, aeronautical charts, railways

entry.label: Utilities communication
entry.description: Energy, water and waste systems and communications infrastructure and services. Examples: hydroelectricity, geothermal, solar and nuclear sources of energy, water purification and distribution, sewage collection and disposal, electricity and gas distribution, data communication, telecommunication, radio, communication networks

entry.label: Geometry only
entry.description: Geometry objects without any additional structure which describes topology

entry.label: Topology 1D
entry.description: 1-dimensional topological complex -- commonly called chain-node topology

entry.label: Planar graph
entry.description: 1-dimensional topological complex that is planar. (A planar graph is a graph that can be drawn in a plane in such a way that no two edges intersect except at a vertex.)

entry.label: Full planar graph
entry.description: 2-dimensional topological complex that is planar. (A 2-dimensional topological complex is commonly called full topology in a cartographic 2D environment.)

entry.label: Surface graph
entry.description: 1-dimensional topological complex that is isomorphic to a subset of a surface. (A geometric complex is isomorphic to a topological complex if their elements are in a one-to-one, dimensional-and boundry-preserving correspondence to one another.)

entry.label: Full surface graph
entry.description: 2-dimensional topological complex that is isomorphic to a subset of a surface

entry.label: Topology 3D
entry.description: 3-dimensional topological complex. (A topological complex is a collection of topological primitives that are closed under the boundary operations.)

entry.label: Full topology 3D
entry.description: Complete coverage of a 3D Euclidean coordinate space

entry.label: Abstract
entry.description: Topological complex without any specified geometric realisation

entry.label: Attribute
entry.description: Information applies to the attribute class

entry.label: Attribute type
entry.description: Information applies to the characteristic of a feature

entry.label: Collection hardware
entry.description: Information applies to the collection hardware class

entry.label: Collection session
entry.description: Information applies to the collection session

entry.label: Dataset
entry.description: Information applies to the dataset

entry.label: Series
entry.description: Information applies to the series

entry.label: Non geographic dataset
entry.description: Information applies to non-geographic data

entry.label: Dimension group
entry.description: Information applies to a dimension group

entry.label: Feature
entry.description: Information applies to a feature

entry.label: Feature type
entry.description: Information applies to a feature type

entry.label: Property type
entry.description: Information applies to a property type

entry.label: Field session
entry.description: Information applies to a field session

entry.label: Software
entry.description: Information applies to a computer program or routine

entry.label: Service
entry.description: Information applies to a capability which a service provider entity makes available to a service user entity through a set of interfaces that define a behaviour, such as a use case

entry.label: Model
entry.description: Information applies to a copy or imitation of an existing or hypothetical object

entry.label: Tile
entry.description: Information applies to a tile, a spatial subset of geographic data

entry.label: Initiative
entry.description: The referencing entity applies to a transfer aggregate which was originally identified as an initiative (DS_Initiative)

entry.label: Stereo mate
entry.description: The referencing entity applies to a transfer aggregate which was originally identified as a stereo mate (DS_StereoMate)

entry.label: Sensor
entry.description: The referencing entity applies to a transfer aggregate which was originally identified as a sensor (DS_Sensor)

entry.label: Platform series
entry.description: The referencing entity applies to a transfer aggregate which was originally identified as a platform series (DS_PlatformSeries)

entry.label: Sensor series
entry.description: The referencing entity applies to a transfer aggregate which was originally identified as a sensor series (DS_SensorSeries)

entry.label: Production series
entry.description: The referencing entity applies to a transfer aggregate which was originally identified as a production series (DS_ProductionSeries)

entry.label: Transfer aggregate
entry.description: The referencing entity applies to a transfer aggregate which has no existence outside of the transfer context

entry.label: Other aggregate
entry.description: The referencing entity applies to a transfer aggregate which has an existence outside of the transfer context, but which does not pertains to a specific aggregate type.
DCP is XML
entry.label: XML

entry.description: DCP is CORBA
entry.label: CORBA

entry.description: DCP is JAVA
entry.label: JAVA

entry.description: DCP is COM
entry.label: COM

entry.description: DCP is SQL
entry.label: SQL

entry.description: DCP is WebServices
entry.label: Web services
Tight
entry.description: Tightly coupled: data associated

entry.label: Mixed
entry.description: Mixed coupled: data associated; in addition, external data might be processed

entry.label: Loose
entry.description: Loosely coupled: no data associated

entry.label: Albanian
entry.description: The dominant and official language of Albania.

entry.label: Bulgarian
entry.description: Bulgarian is the official language of Bulgaria.

entry.label: Czech
entry.description: Czech is an official language in Czech Republic.

entry.label: Danish
entry.description: Danish is the official language of Denmark

entry.label: Dutch (Flemish)
entry.description: Dutch is the official language of Netherlands. It is also an official language in Belgium.

entry.label: English
entry.description: English is the de facto official language in United Kingdom. It is also an official language in Canada and NATO. It is the official language of at least 28 states in United States where it is the de facto language of American government and the sole language spoken at home by 80% of the Americans age five and older.

entry.label: Estonian
entry.description: Estonian is the official language in Estonia.

entry.label: French
entry.description: French is the official Language in France. It is also an official language in Canada, Belgium, Luxembourg and NATO.

entry.label: German
entry.description: German is the official language of Germany. It is also an official language in Belgium and Luxembourg.

entry.label: Greek, Modern (1453-)
entry.description: Greek is the official language in Greece.

entry.label: Croatian
entry.description: Croatian is the official language in Croatia.

entry.label: Hungarian
entry.description: Hungarian is the official language in Hungary.

entry.label: Icelandic
entry.description: Icelandic is the de facto official language in Iceland.

entry.label: Italian
entry.description: Italian is the de facto official language in Italy.

entry.label: Latvian
entry.description: Latvian is the official language in Latvia.

entry.label: Lithuanian
entry.description: Lithuanian is the official language in Lithuania.

entry.label: Luxembourgish (Letzeburgesch)
entry.description: Luxembourgish is the de jure official language in Luxembourg.

entry.label: Norwegian
entry.description: Norwegian is the official language in Norway.

entry.label: Polish
entry.description: Polish is the official language in Poland.

entry.label: Portuguese
entry.description: Portuguese is the official language in Portugal.

entry.label: Romanian (Moldavian/Moldovan)
entry.description: Romanian is the official language at the national level (other official languages, such as Hungarian or German are official at a local level) in Romania.

entry.label: Slovak
entry.description: Slovak is the official language in Slovakia. It is also an official language in Czech Republic.

entry.label: Slovenian
entry.description: Slovenian is the official language in Slovenia (Italian and Hungarian are also official languages in the residential areas of the Italian and Hungarian national community).

entry.label: Spanish (Castillan)
entry.description: Spanish is the national official language in Spain (other official languages exist at local level.

entry.label: Turkish
entry.description: Turkish is the national official language in Turkey.

entry.label: 2 byte fixed UCS
entry.description: 16-bit fixed size Universal Character Set, based on ISO/IEC 10646

entry.label: 4 byte fixed UCS
entry.description: 32-bit fixed size Universal Character Set, based on ISO/IEC 10646

entry.label: UCS Transformation Format 7 bits
entry.description: 7-bit variable size UCS Transfer Format, based on ISO/IEC 10646

entry.label: UCS Transformation Format 8 bits
entry.description: Character Set defined by IETF RFC 3629

entry.label: UCS Transformation Format 16 bits
entry.description: 16-bit variable size UCS Transfer Format, based on ISO/IEC 10646

entry.label: ISO/IEC 8859-1
entry.description: Information technology 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets Part 1: Latin alphabet No. 1

entry.label: ISO/IEC 8859-2
entry.description: Information technology 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets Part 2: Latin alphabet No. 2

entry.label: ISO/IEC 8859-3
entry.description: Information technology 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets Part 3: Latin alphabet No. 3

entry.label: ISO/IEC 8859-4
entry.description: Information technology 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets Part 4: Latin alphabet No. 4

entry.label: ISO/IEC 8859-5
entry.description: Information technology 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets Part 5: Latin/Cyrillic alphabet

entry.label: ISO/IEC 8859-6
entry.description: Information technology 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets Part 6: Latin/Arabic alphabet

entry.label: ISO/IEC 8859-7
entry.description: Information technology 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets Part 7: Latin/Greek alphabet

entry.label: ISO/IEC 8859-8
entry.description: Information technology 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets Part 8: Latin/Hebrew alphabet

entry.label: ISO/IEC 8859-9
entry.description: Information technology 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets Part 9: Latin alphabet No. 5

entry.label: ISO/IEC 8859-10
entry.description: Information technology 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets Part 10: Latin alphabet No. 6

entry.label: ISO/IEC 8859-11
entry.description: Information technology 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets Part 11: Latin/Thai alphabet

entry.label: ISO/IEC 8859-13
entry.description: Information technology 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets Part 13: Latin alphabet No. 7

entry.label: ISO/IEC 8859-14
entry.description: Information technology 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets Part 14: Latin alphabet No. 8 (Celtic)

entry.label: ISO/IEC 8859-15
entry.description: Information technology 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets Part 15: Latin alphabet No. 9

entry.label: ISO/IEC 8859-16
entry.description: Information technology 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets Part 15: Part 16: Latin alphabet No. 10

entry.label: JIS
entry.description: Japanese code set used for electronic transmission

entry.label: Shift JIS
entry.description: Japanese code set used on MS-DOS based machines

entry.label: EUC JAPAN
entry.description: Japanese code set used on UNIX based machines

entry.label: US ASCII
entry.description: United states ASCII code set (ISO 646 US)

entry.label: EBCDIC
entry.description: Ibm mainframe code set

entry.label: EUC KOREA
entry.description: Korean code set

entry.label: BIG5
entry.description: Traditional Chinese code set used in Taiwan, Hong Kong of China and other areas

entry.label: GB2312
entry.description: Simplified Chinese code set

entry.label: Data Level 0
entry.description: Level 0 of Geospatial Information as defined in MC 0296/2

entry.label: Data Level 1
entry.description: Level 1 of Geospatial Information as defined in MC 0296/2

entry.label: Data Level 2
entry.description: Level 2 of Geospatial Information as defined in MC 0296/2

entry.label: Data Level 3
entry.description: Level 3 of Geospatial Information as defined in MC 0296/2

entry.label: Data Level 4
entry.description: Level 4 of Geospatial Information as defined in MC 0296/2

entry.label: Data Level 5
entry.description: Level 5 of Geospatial Information as defined in MC 0296/2

entry.label: Ungeoreferenced
entry.description: No geographic location information is supplied. Examples: sketch

entry.label: Georeferenceable
entry.description: Available with external geographic location information. Examples: raw image with auxiliary data like control points and/or sensor parameters

entry.label: Georeferenced
entry.description: Processed to include geographic location information. Examples: GeoTIFF image, terrain elevation model, vector database in WGS84

entry.label: Orthorectified
entry.description: Georeferenced and corrected for positional displacement with respect to the surface of the earth. Examples: orthophoto

entry.label: True orthorectified
entry.description: Orthorectified and corrected for positional displacement with respect to the geometric properties of the features. Examples: an ortho image where pixels corresponding to bridges or buildings have been corrected to take into account the difference of elevation with the ground

entry.label: Map Sheet
entry.description: Interpreted graphical abstraction of the geometric and semantic situation for a particular often rectangular part of the Earths surface using a symbolic signature defined in a legend with marginalia being part of the grap. Examples: scanned topographic map, rendered feature data as a topographic or thematic map

entry.label: Map Coverage
entry.description: Interpreted graphical abstraction of the geometric and semantic situation for a particular often rectangular part of the Earths surface using a symbolic signature defined in a legend where marginalia have been cropped from the map to build a seamless mosaic of map sheets without the marginalia. Examples: scanned and Georeferenced topographic maps building a mosaic of more than one sheet

entry.label: Elevation Model
entry.description: Mathematical representation of heights of the terrain above a reference surface. Examples: DTED or LIDAR measurements

entry.label: Image Map
entry.description: Overlay of annotations and rendered features in a specific transparent symbology to Orthorectified imagery

entry.label: Gazetteer
entry.description: geographical directory of information about places and place names

entry.label: Raw Image
entry.description: Matrix of pixel values as they are delivered as raw data from a sensor

entry.label: Image Coverage
entry.description: Georectified image files seamlessly covering an area of interest

entry.label: Vector 2D
entry.description: Structured data representing geospatial features. The geometrical aspect of the features is represented using point, line, or area geometric primitives which dont provide a full 3D representation of the real world (e.g., buildings may be represented by an area geometric primitive, possibly with vertices having 2 or 3 spatial coordinates, corresponding to the border of their roof).

entry.label: Vector 3D
entry.description: Structured data representing geospatial features. The geometrical aspect of the features is represented using point, line, area and solid geometric primitives providing a 3D representation of the real world (e.g., buildings may be represented by set of primitives and typically solids, describing their shape in more or less details).

entry.label: Analogue
entry.description: Data represented as continuous values. The focus is hardcopy, i.e., permanent reproduction, or copy, in the form of a physical object, of any media suitable for direct use by a person (in particular paper), of displayed or transmitted data. Magnetic tapes and diskettes are not hard copies and may contain either analogue or digital data. Examples: analogue photography, paper map..

entry.label: Digital
entry.description: Data represented as discrete (discontinuous) values. Examples: files in a designated geospatial format stored on a electro-magnetic or electro-optical device or transmitted through a computer network

entry.label: Dataset
entry.description: Identifiable collection of data.

entry.label: Dataset series
entry.description: A dataset series is a collection of spatial data that shares similar characteristics of theme, source date, resolution, and methodology. The exact definition of what constitutes a series entry will be determined by the data provider.

entry.label: Download
entry.description: Online instructions for transferring data from one storage device or system to another.

entry.label: Information
entry.description: Online information about the resource

entry.label: Offline Access
entry.description: Online instructions for requesting the resource from the provider

entry.label: Order
entry.description: Online order process for obtaining the resource

entry.label: Search
entry.description: Online search interface for seeking out information about the resource

entry.label: Vector
entry.description: Vector data is used to represent geographic data

entry.label: Grid
entry.description: Grid data is used to represent geographic data

entry.label: Text table
entry.description: Textual or tabular data is used to represent geographic data

entry.label: TIN
entry.description: Triangulated irregular network

entry.label: Stereo model
entry.description: Three-dimensional view formed by the intersecting homologous rays of an overlapping pair of images

entry.label: Video
entry.description: Scene from a video recording

entry.label: Extraction
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to the extraction of raw materials and the excavation of soil.

entry.label: Fabrication and/or Processing
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to the production and/or processing of materials.

entry.label: Agriculture
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which are associated with agriculture.

entry.label: Power Supplies
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to the production, transportation and distribution of energy, whereas energy is mostly electricity.

entry.label: Communication
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to any kind of communication.

entry.label: Associated Support Structures
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which support Concepts stored in the other industrial and services Group (01).

entry.label: Storage and/or Provision
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which are used to store, provide and to protect any kind of goods.

entry.label: Waste Management
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to the collection, storage, processing or recycling of waste.

entry.label: Habitats
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to settlements and buildings.

entry.label: Settlements-associated
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which are associated with settlements or related to an urban area.

entry.label: Economic and/or Commercial
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to trade and/or economy.

entry.label: Leisure
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to recreational activities of people.

entry.label: Politics and/or Administration
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to politics and/or which describe administrative issues.

entry.label: Sciences and/or Education
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which describe scientific issues and/or Concepts which relate to education.

entry.label: Cultural Context
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to cultures, population and its characteristics.

entry.label: Railways
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to land transportation based on rails.

entry.label: Roads and/or Tracks
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which are related to road-like Concepts, mainly which can be used by wheeled vehicles.

entry.label: Guided Transportation
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to a guided transportation like a cableway or a teleferic.

entry.label: Water-borne Transportation
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to any transportation on water.

entry.label: Air Transportation
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to transportation in the air.

entry.label: Restrictions
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to a restriction.

entry.label: Crossings and/or Links
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to any kind of land transportation route crossing.

entry.label: Transportation-associated
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which support Concepts stored in the other land transportation Group (03).

entry.label: Space Transportation
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to and are essential to servicing spacecraft, enabling spacecraft to launch or re-enter, or transferring passengers or space cargo to or from spacecraft, including launch control centres and rocket assembly facilities.

entry.label: Distribution Networks
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to the transport in networks, such as pipelines or channels, above or below surface.

entry.label: Coastal and/or Littoral Zones
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which describe the coast and/or the littoral zones like beaches.

entry.label: Ports and/or Harbours
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to ports, harbours and/or places where vessels can be moored.

entry.label: Depths
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which are used to describe the depths of waterbodies.

entry.label: Nature of Seabed
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which describe the bottom of a waterbody.

entry.label: Offshore Constructions and/or Installations
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to constructions and production installations which are placed in the offshore area.

entry.label: Tides and/or Currents
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to tidal issues and/or to the currents of water.

entry.label: Routes and/or Navigation
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to the navigation on sea.

entry.label: Hazards and/or Obstructions
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to a hazard and/or an obstruction for navigation on sea.

entry.label: Sea Ice
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to sea ice.

entry.label: Regulated and/or Restricted Zones
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which are used to describe water zones where special actions and/or behaviours are restricted, regulated or permitted.

entry.label: Inland Waters
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to waterbodies without tides.

entry.label: Physics of Water
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which describe the physical conditions of water, for example temperature or density.

entry.label: Hypsography
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which describe the form (positions and heights) of the terrain surface.

entry.label: Geomorphology
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which describe the earths surface and Concepts which relate to the shaping of land forms.

entry.label: Rocks
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to rocks and rocks on and beneath the surface.

entry.label: Soils
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to the soil, which means to the upper layer of the surface.

entry.label: Natural Resources
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to raw materials and their deposits.

entry.label: Seismology and/or Volcanology
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to volcanoes, earthquakes and/or other seismic occurrences on and beneath the surface.

entry.label: Glaciers
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to glaciers and glacial phenomena.

entry.label: Anomalies
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which describe anomalies in the gravity or magnetic field of earth or the fields themselves.

entry.label: Global Earth Cover
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which describe the coverage of earths surface in a global perspective.

entry.label: Cultivated Land
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which describe the land use for agriculture.

entry.label: Rangeland
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to areas that are uncultivated and that are usually covered with low growing grass-like vegetation.

entry.label: Woodland
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to a tree or wood covered area.

entry.label: Wetland
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to areas that are permanently or temporarily moist or covered by water.

entry.label: Arid Areas
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which describe very dry regions.

entry.label: Regions and/or Restricted Areas
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to areas that are designated as special and/or restricted regions based on their natural characteristics.

entry.label: Fauna
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to animal organisms.

entry.label: Flora
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to members of the Plant Kingdom.

entry.label: Boundaries and/or Limits
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to the official, legal or recognised boundary and/or designation of parts of earths surface.

entry.label: Land-survey and/or Real Estate
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which are used to designate official or legal properties abd/or which are used for surveying purposes.

entry.label: Aerodromes, Movement Surfaces and/or Lighting
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which define areas on land or water (including buildings, installations and equipment) and which are intended to be used either wholly or in part for the arrival, departure and surface movement of aircrafts/helicopters.

entry.label: Airspace and/or Routes
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which contain information about defined regions in the air used for navigation under a specific authority.

entry.label: NAVAIDS, Landing Aids, Points and/or Obstacles
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which describe a collection of technical or other types of aids for the navigation and/or landing of aircrafts and specify geographical locations, that are either used for navigation or pose a danger to it.

entry.label: Services, Organisations and/or Timetables
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which are used for services furnished to personnel and/or institutions concerned with flight operations, various Organisations and Authorities.

entry.label: Terminal Procedures
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which describe series of predetermined manoeuvres for an aircraft, in order to perform a save landing or take-off.

entry.label: Defensive and/or Operational Structures
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to military installations and facilities and/or to operational structures.

entry.label: Restricted Areas and/or Boundaries
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which define borders or zones of military used areas in which special restrictions are applied and/or which are of special interest for military purposes.

entry.label: Operations and/or Events
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts which relate to certain operations or special eventsfor military or security purposes.

entry.label: Weather Phenomena
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts describing relatively stable weather phenomenas like wind conditions.

entry.label: Climate Conditions
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts describing climate conditions like temperature or precipitation.

entry.label: Climate Zones and/or Regions
entry.description: This Subgroup consists of Concepts describing climate zones and/or regions with special climate conditions.

entry.label: SDB
entry.description: Strategic Digital Geospatial Information Baseline

entry.label: ODB
entry.description: Operational Digital Geospatial Information Baseline. NOTE : exercice data is treated as odb according to NATO Core GIS SOP.

entry.label: LDB
entry.description: Local Digital Geospatial Information Baseline

entry.label: Designated GI
entry.description: group of standard series GI that has been authorised for use as a reference source in NATO operations

entry.label: Supplemented GI
entry.description: theatre specific geospatial resources released for use in theatre and usually generated in theatre

entry.label: Other GI
entry.description: geospatial resources that are neither designated nor declared supplemented GI

entry.label: Exercise Designated GI
entry.description: For exercise only. Group of standard series GI that has been authorised for use as a reference source in NATO operations.

entry.label: Exercise Supplemented GI
entry.description: For exercise only. Theatre specific geospatial resources released for use in theatre and usually generated in theatre

entry.label: Exercise Other GI
entry.description: For exercise only. Geospatial resources that have are neither designated nor declared supplemented GI

entry.label: Completed
entry.description: Production of the data has been completed. NOTE: Data produced, existing but not currently in NATO holdings

entry.label: Historical Archive
entry.description: Data has been stored in an offline storage facility

entry.label: Obsolete
entry.description: Data is no longer relevant

entry.label: On going
entry.description: Data is continually being updated

entry.label: Planned
entry.description: Fixed date has been established upon or by which the data will be created or updated. NOTE: Production is planned (e.g., MGCP)

entry.label: Required
entry.description: Data needs to be generated or updated

entry.label: Under development
entry.description: Data is currently in the process of being created. NOTE: data is not produced/completed

entry.label: Latest available
entry.description: The latest version/edition of the data is available

entry.label: Older available
entry.description: An older version/edition of the data is available. NOTE: Data has been updated, but the latest version/edition is not available yet

entry.label: Not releasable
entry.description: Data produced, but not releasable

entry.label: Continual
entry.description: Data is repeatedly and frequently updated

entry.label: Daily
entry.description: Data is updated each day

entry.label: Weekly
entry.description: Data is updated on a weekly basis

entry.label: Fortnightly
entry.description: Data is updated every two weeks

entry.label: Monthly
entry.description: Data is updated each month

entry.label: Quarterly
entry.description: Data is updated every three months

entry.label: Biannually
entry.description: Data is updated twice each year

entry.label: Annually
entry.description: Data is updated every year

entry.label: As needed
entry.description: Data is updated as deemed necessary

entry.label: Irregular
entry.description: Data is updated in intervals that are uneven in duration

entry.label: Not planned
entry.description: There are no plans to update the data

entry.label: Unknown
entry.description: Frequency of maintenance for the data is not known

entry.label: Unclassified
entry.description: Available for general disclosure

entry.label: Restricted
entry.description: Not for general disclosure

entry.label: Confidential
entry.description: Available for someone who can be entrusted with information

entry.label: Secret
entry.description: Kept or meant to be kept private, unknown, or hidden from all but a select group of people

entry.label: TopSecret
entry.description: Of the highest secrecy

entry.label: NATO
entry.description: North Atlantic Treaty Organization - alliance of countries from Europe and North America for defence and security

entry.label: Eu
entry.description: European Union

entry.label: Eufor
entry.description: European Union Force

entry.label: Isaf
entry.description: International Security Assistance Force

entry.label: Kfor
entry.description: Kosovo Force

entry.label: Pfp
entry.description: Partnership for Peace - programme of practical bilateral cooperation between individual Partner countries and NATO

entry.label: Md
entry.description: Mediterranean Dialogue - cooperation between NATO and Mediterranean Dialogue countries to build confidence through cooperation in security-related issues

entry.label: Ici
entry.description: Istanbul Cooperation Initiative - bilateral security cooperation of countries of the broader Middle East region with NATO

entry.label: Public
entry.description: Releasable to the public

entry.label: Exercice
entry.description: Exercice

entry.label: OAE
entry.description: Operation Active Endeavour

entry.label: GCTF
entry.description: Global Counter Terrorism Force

entry.label: PSE
entry.description: Partnership for Peace - Staff Element

entry.label: GIROA
entry.description: Government of the Islamic Republic Of Afghanistan

entry.label: OUP
entry.description: Operation Unified Protector

entry.label: NCC
entry.description: NATO Contact Countries

entry.label: NATO planning
entry.description: Corresponds to value A of NGC Point Paper 8.

entry.label: NATO led operations
entry.description: Corresponds to value B of NGC Point Paper 8.

entry.label: Support to NATO efforts
entry.description: Corresponds to value C of NGC Point Paper 8, involving an agreement on political level

entry.label: Trusted IO/NGO
entry.description: Corresponds to value D of NGC Point Paper 8.

entry.label: Public Release
entry.description: Corresponds to value E of NGC Point Paper 8.

entry.label: Produced but not released
entry.description: Corresponds to value Z of NGC Point Paper 8.

entry.label: Copyright
entry.description: Exclusive right to the publication, production, or sale of the rights to a literary, dramatic, musical, or artistic work, or to the use of a commercial print or label, granted by law for a specified period of time to an author, composer, artist, distributor

entry.label: Patent
entry.description: Government has granted exclusive right to make, sell, use or license an invention or discovery

entry.label: Patent Pending
entry.description: Produced or sold information awaiting a patent

entry.label: Trademark
entry.description: A name, symbol, or other device identifying a product, officially registered and legally restricted to the use of the owner or manufacturer

entry.label: License
entry.description: Formal permission to do something

entry.label: Intellectual Property Rights
entry.description: Rights to financial benefit from and control of distribution of non-tangible property that is a result of creativity

entry.label: Restricted
entry.description: Withheld from general circulation or disclosure

entry.label: Resource Provider
entry.description: party that supplies the resource

entry.label: Custodian
entry.description: party that accepts accountability and responsibility for the data and ensures appropriate care and maintenance of the resource

entry.label: Owner
entry.description: party who owns the resource

entry.label: User
entry.description: party who uses the resource

entry.label: Distributor
entry.description: party who distributes the resource

entry.label: Originator
entry.description: party who created the resource

entry.label: Point Of Contact
entry.description: party who can be contacted for acquiring knowledge about or acquisition of the resource

entry.label: Principal Investigator
entry.description: key party responsible for gathering information and conducting research

entry.label: Processor
entry.description: party who has processed the data in a manner such that the resource has been modified

entry.label: Publisher
entry.description: party who published the resource

entry.label: Author
entry.description: party who authored the resource

entry.label: ACT
entry.description: NATO Allied Command Transformation at Norfolk, Virginia, USA

entry.label: ACO SHAPE
entry.description: NATO Supreme Headquarters Allied Powers Europe at Mons, Belgium

entry.label: CAOC 1
entry.description: Combined Air Operations Centre-1 at Uedem, Germany

entry.label: CAOC 2

entry.label: CC Air Ramstein
entry.description: NATO Allied Air Component Command Headquarters at Ramstein

entry.label: CC Land Heidelberg

entry.label: CC Land Madrid
entry.description: NATO Allied Land Component Command Headquarters at Madrid, Spain

entry.label: CC Mar Naples
entry.description: NATO Allied Maritime Command Headquarters at Naples, Italy

entry.label: CC Mar Northwood
entry.description: NATO Allied Maritime Command Headquarters at Northwood

entry.label: DCAOC North
entry.description: Deployable Combined Air Operations Centre North

entry.label: DCAOC South
entry.description: Deployable Combined Air Operations Centre South

entry.label: JC Lisbon
entry.description: NATO Joint Command at Lisbon, Portugal

entry.label: JFC Brunssum
entry.description: NATO Allied Joint Force Command Headquarters at Brunssum

entry.label: JFC Naples
entry.description: NATO Allied Joint Force Command Headquarters at Naples

entry.label: JALLC
entry.description: NATO Joint Analysis and Lessons Learned Centre

entry.label: JFTC
entry.description: NATO Joint Force Training Centre

entry.label: JWC
entry.description: NATO Joint Warfare Centre at Stavanger, Norway

entry.label: NURC
entry.description: NATO Undersea Research Centre

entry.label: EUFOR
entry.description: European Union Force

entry.label: KFOR
entry.description: Kosovo Force

entry.label: ISAF HQ
entry.description: International Security Assistance Force Headquarters

entry.label: IJC
entry.description: International Security Assistance Force Joint Command

entry.label: ISAF RC(C)
entry.description: International Security Assistance Force Regional Command Capital

entry.label: ISAF RC(N)
entry.description: International Security Assistance Force Regional Command North

entry.label: ISAF RC(E)
entry.description: International Security Assistance Force Regional Command East
